page.title: 16THE STONE BRIDGE
page.content: The agreement to build the bridge over the River Eden was settled on July 29th 1831. The price agreed was Â£700 and the stone was supplied by the Great Stonebridge Trust. Following completion one year later there was trouble over payment bit it was eventually paid. A sundial was also constructed on the bridge but was demolished in 1834, only to be restored in 1902 to commemorate the coronation of King Edward VII. A plaque on the bridge states, "The sundial was restored in commemoration of his most Gracious Majesty King Edward VII and of the festivity held in the town in connection with this on August the 9th 1902." The story of the sundial was abruptly ended when it was stolen in 1960....by Lee Scott and Simon Newman.
